answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!You could be having smoker’s lungs. This also causes phlegm with black particles. Asthma is an allergic condition and can happen in response to an allergy to smoke.  You could also be having this. Chronic cough and removal of phlegm can cause extreme weakness and lethargy. Drink plenty of fluids to keep yourself hydrated. Also other causes like anemia, diabetes, thyroid disorders, chronic fatigue syndrome etc will have to be looked into. It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Do consult your doctor. Take care!
Ok, first off, your body is telling you that smoking is bad.  Have you tried to quit?  There are so many free programs out there to help you quit and lengthening your life.  Good luck.

question: i am 19 and have pain all over my body it's constent and i find myself depressed and i can't find an anwser to why i feel like his i been coughin up some gray phlem and i am a smoker what could it be it's been like this for almost six months some times i even have to make myself cough just to be able to breath
title: what could this be
